channel.title: Posts on Monique's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Monique's Blog

item.title: 鼠疫 （The Plague）
item.description:
《鼠疫》是加缪写在一九四几年写的小说，讲述了一座小城市突然被鼠疫这个病入侵，封城后人们一系列的举动。

鼠疫带来的不仅仅是病痛和死亡，还有对于在平庸的小镇过着平庸的生活的人们翻天覆地的变化。鼠疫的到来是荒谬的，疫情从简简单单一只死去的老鼠逐渐演变成了要封城的地步，人们离奇死亡；鼠疫的离开更是荒谬的，它看似随着时间的流逝消失的无影无踪；有些人幸运的从病痛中恢复了，有些人却为此付出了生命的代价。人们平庸的生活却被这一事件打破，在面对如此近距离的死亡后，他们逐渐开始思考生命的意义，开始思考如何面对“荒谬”。

item.title: Pearl (Movie) Analysis
item.description: She is highly sympathetic yet also disturbingly unhinged. She’s trapped in a suffocating environment after the first world war, burdened with caring for her paralyzed father and living under her mother’s strict authority. Yet she dreams to be a star- a dancer that will one day famous, like such in the Hollywood movies. At the beginning of the film, Pearl admires herself in the mirror. She believes that the image in the mirror (her ideal self) is the sweet, glamorous movie star (yet the role is acutally shaped by the American Dream). It kinda feels like ‘the mirror stage’ Lacan mentioned. During this stage, infants recognize themselves in the mirror. The reflected self appears whole and unified, but the actual self is fragmented and uncoordinated. From this gap, the infant constructs an ‘ideal ego,’ a seemingly complete and coherent self-image. Pearl believes that herself in the mirror is a star, yet it is found on misrecognition, as Pearl can never become the cinematic ideal she chases. She refuses to believe it, yet her mother’s words and her failed audition keeps reminding her that she never will become the Hollywood star she imagines herself to be.

item.title: The Dream
item.description: WORK IN PROGRESS

item.title: The Fountianhead- Q3
item.description:
Dominique Francon loves Roark, yet she struggles to destroy his career. Why? What does she come to understand over the course of the novel that ultimately convinces her to change her mind? How does this conflict of hers relate to the novel’s theme and meaning? In your answer, refer to both The Fountainhead and “Introduction to the Twenty-fifth Anniversary Edition” of The Fountainhead.

Dominique is a conflicted character that pursues her idealism yet is confined to the world by her pessimism. She loves Roark, because he embodies everything she values: greatness, purity, desire, and freedom from social constraints. Dominique admires his greatness, although it is for the same reason that she attempts to destroy his career. She believes that greatness is doomed to fail, to be corrupted by the mediocre, so that’s why she destroys his career.

item.title: Journal One
item.description:
WORK IN PROGRESS

October 1st

It’s been five months since she died. People still look at me as if I’m some question they’re too polite to ask. I sit quiet during the funeral, my black shirt swaying with the wind. The wind blows; it howls, seemingly mourning for my encounter. Besides the wind, everything else was still. Guests shuffled around me, phrases of ‘everything happens for a reason’, ‘it’s a miracle you were spared’ ‘you have to move on’ passed into my ear. They were like droplets of rain, fragile, empty, and disappeared quickly. One ear in, out the other. I guess everyone wanted me to believe that her death was a comma in some divine sentence, which I thought it wasn’t. It felt like a typo one made and didn’t care to change. I met our parents. I see my mother dabbing her tears onto her handkerchief as if she could press them away. I saw my father lowering his head. I guess he didn’t want guests to see him crying. I sat beside them during the funeral. No words were exchanged. I guess they rather wished it was me who died. I did too.

item.title: The Fountianhead- Q2
item.description: Introduction to the Twenty-fifth Anniversary Edition Many people have asked me how I feel about the fact that The Fountainhead has been in print for twenty-five years. I cannot say that I feel anything in particular, except a kind of quiet satisfaction. In this respect, my attitude toward my writing is best expressed by a statement of Victor Hugo: “If a writer wrote merely for his time, I would have to break my pen and throw it away.”

item.title: The Fountianhead- Q1
item.description:
“He rose, beamed and held Dominique’s hand. “Thought I’d drop in on my way home,” he said. “I’ve got something to tell you. How did it go, kid?”

“As I expected it.”

She tore her hat off and threw it down on the first chair in sight. Her hair slanted in a flat curve across her forehead and fell in a straight line to her shoulders; it looked smooth and tight, like a bathing cap of pale, polished metal. She walked to the window and stood looking out over the city. She asked without turning: “What did you want to tell me?”

item.title: 致最真实的女主：写在看完《好想做一次》之后 (Never Have I Ever)
item.description: 我是一个看完影片就喜欢刷评论的人 。在看完《好想做一次》全四季后，我兴高采烈的去不同网站上翻评论和看点评去了。令我诧异的是，Devi（主角）这个角色的行为/性格包含争议：有些人很喜欢她，又有些人很讨厌她。

item.title: 《瞬息全宇宙》中母女关系的变化——从结构主义到辩证法
item.description:
摘要

This paper analyzes the evolving relationship between Evelyn and her daughter Joy in Everything Everywhere All at Once. We seek to answer the following question: Why does the relationship between Evelyn and her daughter undergo such a dramatic transformation? The study analyzes such question through the theoretical lenses of structuralism and Hegelian dialectics, ultimately concluding that the root of the mother-daughter conflict lies in the failure of the Symbolic Order to fully symbolize the Real. Specifically, when facing the collapse of the symbolic order, Evelyn’s initial coping strategy - relying on ‘fantasy’ and ‘adding signifiers that slips along the signifying chain’ to suppress surplus - inevitably produces more surplus, as symbolization always generates new remnants. The excessive use of symbolization leads to the “death” of the subject. Evelyn’s resolution comes not through violently repressing surplus (her daughter’s loss of control), but through facing the surplus, and turning towards containment and symbiosis.

item.title: 黑塞笔下的女人，都活在男人的梦里？（Hesse's Female Characters）
item.description: 黑塞一直是我最喜欢的一位作家之一。他的语言优美，字句之间透露出沉思者的气质。而且，他几乎所有的作品都围绕着“自我”这一主题展开——一个我始终感兴趣，也始终在思索的问题。

item.title: 在轮下 （Unterm Rad）
item.description: 最开始读过黑塞的德米安，感觉很有意思，又开始读起了他的荒原狼。感觉有点难，所以我又回到了他写的比较容易的书，在轮下中。 在表达我的感受前，我还是想先说一下黑塞。我很喜欢黑塞的书，虽然读完需要反复品味，但他的文笔优美，他的想法也很令人深思。我读了两遍德米安，和读完在轮下后一样，感觉每次都多少会有一些新的感悟。

item.title: 第七天（The Seventh Day）
item.description: 这本书讲述了主人公，杨飞死后的几天的经历。他的灵魂似乎没死，因为在死后他立马就被叫去火化了。在要火化的这几天中，他遇到了他的前妻，李青，朋友，鼠妹，和他的父亲。

item.title: Hubristic syndrome Assessing its literary applications through The Great Gatsby and Agamemnon
item.description:
Introduction

From the ancient tragedies of Greece to the modern-day downfalls of business tycoons and political leaders, the concept of hubris has served as a cautionary tale about the perils of unchecked power. The theme hubris was already apparent in Greek tragedies, where it mostly meant disrespecting the gods by not crediting ones’ success or fortune to the gods (Marquez, 2015), often leading to nemesis (divine retribution) and ate (ruin). The meaning of hubris has then evolved into excessive arrogance and over-confidence that leads to self-destruction (Marquez, 2015).

item.title: Babel读后感
item.description: I’ve recently read Babel by R. F. Kuang, an amazing book. What I really loved was character development, the themes Kuang discussed, and how deeply the story resonates with me. At the heart of the novel is Robin, a Chinese student who is ‘adopted’ by Professor Lovell and sent to study translation at Oxford, in the institution known as Babel, during the 19th century. As Robin navigates life in a colonial world, he faces deep identity struggles.

item.title: Activites-Symposium,Feminism
Final Project
item.description:
Screams.

Blood curling screams. Blood that runs like a river. Flesh molded together. Tangled and scattered limbs. Achilles stood in front of him. The head of the spear flew close to him. Everything seemed to happen in slow motion. Then it was pain.

Crucifying pain.

The bronze dagger seemed to pierce through frozen time as it inched towards Hector’s abdominal. It burst right through his sides, and heat seemed to spread towards his whole body. He looked down and thought he’d seen red run up towards him. His eyes slowly closed as the ground rushed to greet him. Is this how it’s supposed to end? The hero, defender of Troy, lay slack on the grounds, as he watched the Greek trample down his home.

item.title: Attitude Towards Loss Aversion: The Differences Across Age and Gender in China
item.description:
Abstract

This study investigates the extent to which loss aversion varies across age and gender in China. Employing an online, survey-based method, this study uses econometric approaches (regression models and the utility function in stata) and examines Chinese people of all ages and genders to assess loss aversion through mixed lottery questions. The findings are inconsistent with the hypothesis, revealing that gender and age aren’t significantly related to loss aversion. There seemed to be no significant differences between women and men, although men are a bit more loss-averse than women. Older people are found to be more loss- averse than younger people. These results contribute to the understanding of loss aversion in a cultural context and provide new insights into gender differences. Questions and research topics are proposed for further understanding and further research.

item.title: Hamilton
item.description:
CHARACTERS

  • ALEXANDER HAMILTON, the first-ever Secretary of the United States Treasury, is the musical’s protagonist.
  • MOTHER, the mother of Hamilton.
  • GEORGE WASHINGTON, the mentor of Hamilton.
  • BURR, the friend and the narrator of Hamilton.
  • ELIZA, wife of Hamilton.
  • JEFFERSON, a rival of Hamilton with opposing views.
  • ENSEMBLE

ACT ONE: YOUTH

Time:

Scene 1

Introduction, several people recite:

PREVIOUS ANCESTOR: (standing in the middle of the stage) How does a bastard, orphan, son of a whore and a Scotsman, dropped in the middle of a forgotten Spot in the Caribbean by providence, impoverished, in squalor Grow up to be a hero and a scholar? (rise arms, move to the right)

item.title: Catching Butterflies
item.description:
Butterflies. What is the first thing that comes to mind when you hear it? It could be the butterfly fluttering in the meadow. But for me, it is the butterflies flying in my stomach. So now you might understand why this x-ray picture with butterflies is doing here. This, quite literally, is just having butterflies in your stomach. So why is it here?

Let me just begin with telling you what having ‘butterflies in your stomach’ means. This describes the nervous energy in your belly before or during situations where you might feel anxious or excited. I hate this feeling, but you see me standing here, which means I have caught some of them (grabs some of it).

item.title: Ender’s Game movie review
item.description:
“In the moment when I truly understand my enemy, understand him well enough to defeat him, then in that very moment I also love him. I think it’s impossible to really understand somebody, what they want, what they believe, and not love them the way they love themselves.”

While I was scrolling through movies, I came across Ender’s game. I haven’t read the book before, so my reviews are only on the movie and some comments and reviews others had on the book. The movie was about people training an army used to fight the Formics (sort of like ants), and Ender was the main character who’s destined to lead the team into winning the war. Personally, I believe that it was a good movie, although there were parts that I was confused with or could be better.

item.title: Beauty of Books
item.description:
I’ve heard a lot of unique topics, so I’m going to start with something common – books. No matter text books we use for class, books we read outside of school for research, novels for relaxing… Books are woven into our lives.

Do you remember the first time you read a book? I couldn’t. But that feeling was something I’d always remember. It felt as if we had an immediate bond, and I couldn’t take my eyes off the intricate and fancy pictures. From the soft, fabricated touch of my first book to the scratchy paper and smooth cover of my recent books, I loved reading. Books have been my companions on adventures through time and space, making it a friend worthy of love and time.

item.title: Line of passion
item.description: Today I’m going to start with something common in our lives—books. I don’t know if you could remember properly the first time when you started reading a book. I couldn’t. But that feeling was something I’d always remember. It felt as if we had an immediate bond, and I couldn’t take my eyes off the intricate and fancy pictures. From the soft, fabricated touch of my first book to the scratchy paper and smooth cover of my recent books, I loved reading. I don’t understand passion or love that clearly, but books have been my companions on adventures through time and space, making it a friend worthy of love and time.

item.title: IMMC International 2024: Assessing Family Pet Ownership Based on Multi-Model Correlation Analysis
item.description:
1. Abstract

During the long river of human history, humans and pets are inseparable. Pets are treasured due to the joy they’ve brought owners and the companionship it brings, cre- ating loving memories. The pet market has risen in the few years, especially during the COVID, when the number of pet owners surged. At the same time, however, more and more pets are getting abandoned, ending up stray and overcrowding the shelters, creat- ing a big burden. People have long been confused of who’s suitable for raising pets, and concerns have been increasing everywhere. To handle this situation, this article will ex- plore a decision evaluating model that help determine what households are suitable for owning a pet and forecasts future pet ownership.

item.title: 蛤蟆先生去看心理医生 （Counselling for Toads）
item.description: 故事的开始，蛤蟆先生抑郁了。他开始酗酒，失眠，变得十分邋遢。于是他的朋友们将他带到了心理医生那里去咨询。与苍鹭先生初次相识，他十分抑郁，给他自己的状态打了两分。但通过一次又一次与苍鹭的讨论，蛤蟆感悟到了自己为什么成为了自己的原因，变得活力满满。不仅如此，他也带领着我一起成长，解了到了我们的不同状态，人生中的不同坐标，增强了对自己的认识。

item.title: Self Determination Theory
item.description: In a psychological view, self-determination means the result or process of acting under one’s own choice, ‘particularly to behaviours that improves one’s circumstance’ (APA dictionary of psychology, 2018; Merriam-Webster, n.d.). Self-determination is useful in overcoming fears, giving humans the courage to achieve more, as did Jerry when going through the tunnel (Lessing, 1957), bringing him growth and maturity. For adolescents, or even young children like Jerry, self-determination could help them make vocational decisions, informed choices, and increase independence (Field, Hoffman, Posch 1997). Increased motivation and satisfaction of three fundamental needs also increases self- determination, helping ones to persevere through challenges. Elouise Cobell presents such characteristic when going against the U.S. government, fighting for the rights of the Blackfoot tribe, bringing justice eventually (Janko, 2013).

item.title: Companion Animal Cloning from a Scientific Viewpoint
item.description:
Introduction

From Dolly the Sheep to Snuppy the Dog, pet cloning is gaining more attention, and the number of people who are considering using this technique to resurrect their pet is climbing. Since commencing operations in 2015, Viagen, a company specializing in pet cloning, has reported an increase in the number of cloning procedures performed. The company has disclosed completing hundreds of procedures to date (Dimitropoulos, 2022). But is this the right thing to do?

item.title: Community Service
Drama performance
Flute: performances
Speech
IMMC First round: 国际赛（中华区）建模大赛（B 题）
item.description:
摘要

自古至今，屋顶在人们的生活中不可缺，它不仅起到遮风、挡雨、防晒、保温、隔热的作用，同时还代表着家庭和睦、民生安全，更在历史中象征着权力地位。屋顶所处地区的气候特征影响屋顶屋顶结构，人们的品味、历史的进程，也在潜移默化地作用于屋顶结构样式的演进。不同地区的屋顶样式、曲度、坡度各不相同，每一种屋顶都有其独特的优势，亦存在缺陷。长久以来人们试图找到最适合某一地区的最优屋顶配置，但由于环境、经济、人文的多种因素，此问题很难完美解答。因此，本文根据题目中的三个问题，试图找到不同地区屋顶的最佳配置。
